channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024050468
item.description:
Report E-2024050468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding two damaged 55-gallon steel drums containing hazardous product, H.B. Fuller 14216.One drum was punctured by a forklift and the other was damaged when trying to move it away from the punctured drum. A Contractor was called to overpack both drums. The Contractor advised that an estimated 25-gallons of product released onto the wooden trailer floor and the concrete beneath the trailer. The trailer floor was impacted in a 15’x8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer was impacted in a 10’x 10’ area. The Contractor used oil dry, absorbent pads, and booms to contain and clean-up the release. Two additional drums of waste were generated for the impacted clean-up debris. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024050528
item.description:
Report E-2024050528

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from four (4) 5-gallon metal pails due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents into four (4) 5-gallon poly pails. The damaged 5-gallon metal pails were overpacked into four (4) 10-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
